Requirements: Completed online graduate application, Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution, Official transcripts from all institutions attended, Minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA for full acceptance, Two letters of recommendation, Statement of purpose, Copy of teaching license (if applicable).

Completed online graduate application; Official transcripts from all institutions attended sent directly to the University of Findlay, Office of Admissions; GPA of 3.0 or higher; Two letters of recommendation; A current résumé or curriculum vitae; A statement of purpose; A writing sample
Program name: Master of Arts in Professional Communication

Requirements: Completed online application; Official transcripts from all institutions attended; Overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher; A current résumé or curriculum vitae that demonstrates relevant professional experience; A formal academic writing sample of at least five pages (e.g., a paper from a previous undergraduate or graduate course); A 500-700-word statement of purpose describing your educational and professional goals and how the Master of Arts in Rhetoric and Writing will help you achieve those goals; Two letters of recommendation from professional or academic references (sent directly from the reference).
Program name: Master of Arts in Rhetoric and Writing

Requirements: Completed online graduate application. Official transcripts from all institutions attended. A grade point average of 3.0 or higher. A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Two letters of recommendation. A one-page statement of purpose explaining your interests in TESOL and Applied Linguistics and your career goals. A resume or curriculum vitae. Students for whom English is not their first language must submit a TOEFL score of 79 (iBT), an IELTS score of 6.5, or a Duolingo score of 105.
Program name: Master of Arts in TESOL and Applied Linguistics

Requirements: To be considered for admission into the Master of Business Administration program, you must have: A completed online application. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution. Official transcripts from all institutions attended sent directly to the University of Findlay's Office of Admissions. A cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher is required.* One letter of recommendation. Current resume. A personal statement outlining your professional goals and how the University of Findlay’s MBA can help you achieve them. *Applicants with a GPA between 2.5 and 2.99 can be conditionally admitted.

To be considered for admission, applicants must submit the following items to the Occupational Therapy Centralized Application Service (OTCAS). Apply here: https://portal.otcas.org/.

Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0
Minimum prerequisite GPA of 3.0
No prerequisite course grade can be less than a “C”
Prerequisite courses must be completed within seven years of matriculation into the OT program
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions
Three letters of recommendation
Minimum of 40 observation hours are required in at least two diverse practice settings; a minimum of 20 hours in each setting. Hours must be verified by an OTR or COTA.
Personal statement addressing why you selected OT as a career and how an OT degree relates to your immediate and long-term professional goals. Describe how your personal, educational, and professional background will help you achieve your goals.

Application must be submitted through the Centralized Application Service for Physician Assistants (CASPA).

Application Requirements:
- Baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution
- All prerequisite courses must be completed at a regionally accredited U.S. institution with a C or better.
- Overall GPA of 3.0 or higher (on a 4.0 scale).
- Overall science GPA of 3.0 or higher (on a 4.0 scale).
- Prerequisite GPA of 3.0 or higher (on a 4.0 scale).
- The GRE is no longer required for admission.
- Technical Standards acknowledgment is required.
- A minimum of 500 hours of direct patient care experience is required.
- Two letters of reference.
- CASPer test score submission.
- Applicants must be U.S. citizens or permanent residents.

Completed online graduate application; Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution; Official transcripts from all institutions attended; Overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0; Resume; Statement of Purpose: A one-page personal statement describing your professional goals and why you are choosing this program; One of the following: 1. Hold an undergraduate degree in computer science with an overall GPA of 3.0 or higher from a U.S. regionally accredited institution. 2. Pass the GRE with a quantitative score of 155 or higher, a verbal score of 150 or higher, and an analytical writing score of 4.0 or higher. 3. Pass the MSASA challenge exam. 4. Complete, with a grade of B or higher, the following University of Findlay courses: CSCI 501 and CSCI 502.
Program name: Master of Science in Applied Security and Analytics

Requirements: Completed online application; Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution; Official transcripts from all institutions attended; Minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale (applicants with a GPA of at least 2.7 may be considered for conditional admission); Resume; A statement of purpose describing your professional goals and why you are interested in pursuing the master's degree at The University of Findlay.
Program name: Master of Science in Environmental, Safety and Health Management

Requirements: Complete the online application. Hold a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Possess a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale or a 2.7-2.99 with three years of related work experience in healthcare or information technology. Submit official transcripts from all institutions attended. Submit a resume of professional experience. Submit a statement of purpose. Two recommendation forms from professional or academic references.
Program name: Master of Science in Health Informatics

Requirements: Completed online application; Official transcripts from all institutions attended (send to Findlay's admissions office); Minimum 3.0 GPA; Copy of American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) certification and registration in Radiography (R), Nuclear Medicine (N), Sonography (S), or Radiation Therapy (T); Copy of state license (if applicable); Completed prerequisites (must be completed with a "C" or better): College algebra or higher math, English composition, Medical terminology; Resume/CV detailing professional work experience; Personal statement describing career goals; Three letters of recommendation.
Program name: Master of Science in Radiologic Sciences

Requirements:
Completed online graduate application
Official transcripts from all institutions attended; undergraduate and graduate
Master's degree from a regionally accredited institution
Minimum graduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
Vita or resume outlining professional and educational experience
Personal statement addressing the question "Why a Doctorate in Education from The University of Findlay?"
Two letters of recommendation​
Successful interview with the Doctoral Admissions Committee
If an applicant's native language is not English and he/she has not graduated from an approved English-speaking university, then the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) is required.

Bachelor’s degree in psychology or related field from a regionally-accredited institution
Overall undergraduate grade point average of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
Psychology GPA of at least 3.25
Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended
A current Curriculum Vita (CV) or resume
Three letters of recommendation
A one-page statement describing your career goals, how this degree will help you attain them, and your qualifications for this profession
A writing sample
Graduate Record Exam (GRE) is NOT required for admission to the Ed.D. in School Psychology program
A successful interview with program faculty
Program name: Doctor of Education in School Psychology

Requirements: The University of Findlay's OTD program is a participant in the Centralized Application Service for Occupational Therapy (OTCAS) for all applicants (including current UF students). A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Completion of all prerequisite courses with a grade of C or better. Prerequisite coursework must be completed within seven years prior to application. 20 hours of observation with an occupational therapist or occupational therapy assistant in a minimum of two different practice settings. The observation form is provided here. Three letters of recommendation submitted through OTCAS. On-campus interview by invitation only. Students for whom English is their second language must submit a TOEFL score of 89 with a 26 in speaking or higher.

Completion of a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution prior to the start of the program. Minimum cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Minimum prerequisite science and math GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Completion of all prerequisite courses with a grade of 'C' or better prior to the start of the program. Two letters of recommendation are required (one must be from a physical therapist). Observation hours - a minimum of 40 hours of observation in at least two different physical therapy practice settings is required. We require applicants to use the PTCAS platform to record observation hours. Graduate Record Exam (GRE) is not required. All students accepted into the University of Findlay's DPT program will be required to complete a background check and drug screen. All application materials must be submitted through PTCAS.

To be considered for admission, applicants must complete the PharmCAS Application and submit official transcripts. A minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 is required. PCAT scores are not required for admission. Two letters of recommendation are required to be submitted through PharmCAS. Applicants are required to complete all prerequisite coursework prior to matriculation. The College of Pharmacy requires a personal, on-campus interview. All applicants must be able to meet the technical standards of the pharmacy program.

To be admitted to the Data Analytics Certificate program, the applicant must meet the following criteria: 1. A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution, or the international equivalent; 2. Completion of the Graduate application; 3. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.

Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Meet one of the two following requirements: Have a graduate degree in the teaching discipline from an accredited institution; or Have completed at least 18 graduate credit hours in the teaching discipline from an accredited institution. A cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher from a completed baccalaureate degree program or a 3.0 or higher on all graduate coursework. Completed University of Findlay application. Official transcripts from all institutions attended.
Program name: Dual Enrollment Certificate in Language Arts

Requirements:
Completed online graduate application
A master's degree or higher from a regionally accredited institution
Official transcripts from all institutions attended, undergraduate and graduate

Bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution, documented by an official transcript. A cumulative GPA of 2.75 or above. A resume listing work experience. A brief (1-2 page) statement of purpose detailing career goals and how this program will help achieve those goals. One letter of recommendation from an academic or professional source.
Applicants must complete the online application for admission and submit official transcripts of all previous college coursework. No standardized graduate exam is required for admission.

The University of Findlay’s post-baccalaureate certificate in health informatics is intended for students who have completed a bachelor's degree. Students are encouraged to apply for admission to the health informatics certificate program if they meet the following criteria: Minimum 2.7 cumulative undergraduate GPA on a 4.0 scale​, Completed application form, Official transcripts from all institutions attended, Recommended coursework: one college-level math course, one college-level statistics course
Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Official transcripts from all institutions attended. A minimum 2.75 cumulative GPA for full acceptance. Current Teaching License.

Completed online application.
A minimum of a baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution.
Transcripts of all previous undergraduate and graduate work (if any).
A current résumé.
Statement of Purpose describing your career goals and reasons for pursuing the OH&S Management certificate at The University of Findlay.
No GRE requirement.
Program name: Occupational Health and Safety Management Certificate

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution
Official transcripts from all institutions attended
Overall GPA of 2.75
Completed graduate application

This certificate is specifically designed for practicing school counselors who hold a master’s degree and a current Ohio School Counselor license. To get started, simply apply to the University of Findlay as a non-degree seeking student.

Completed online application, official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended, must have earned a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution, and must have a minimum undergraduate GPA of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale or a 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
